channel.title: Client won't open .zip cache
channel.description: I zipped only the files inside the cache folder and yet it still give me the can't open zip files. HELP please!

item.title: Client won't open .zip cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So like RuneForceGame said, wrong section yes. You want client help.
But here are some things you can try to solve your issue:

  1. Make sure it is a direct link to your cache. example http://examplelink.com/downloads/rsps/cache/cache.zip
    If that example link existed, when you clicked it you would almost instantly begin downloading the file ‘cache.zip’. This is what your client needs. Your client doesn’t know to, or how to, click buttons on html pages or etc, so it cannot navigate a page.

  2. Double check your zip file is only the files you want. I have helped countless people with “cache errors” to only find out that their cache was zipped incorrectly. Your cache, if opened in WinRAR, should look like this. It will probably be smaller and have less files. The cache I used in the pic has a corrupt cache so a lot of stuff was added the hardcode way.

Note: The signlink will automatically generate 4 or 5 files. Each will be similar to main_file_cache.dat or .idx#. This is not your client “only downloading some files”. I only state this because some people have thought it in the past.

  1. New cache downloader. I’ve [url=http://canyourcode.com/pastey/view/eab94563]Given this cache downloader out to people[/url and they’ve had it work for them.

Read full topic

1. What Source do you use?
2. Complete error message.

so you will probably get more answers.
PS. Wrong section.
